H0.text: The sun heating the lake is where water in a lake gets most of its energy to evaporate.

H1.text: Green plants living in the lake provide most of the energy that water in a lake receives to evaporate.

H2.text: Streams entering the lake provide most of the energy for water in a lake to evaporate.

H3.text: Cold springs under the lake provide most of the energy for water in a lake to evaporate.

A4.text: The sun (solar energy) drives evaporation of water from oceans, lakes, moisture in the soil, and other sources of water.
